source_sentence: 爾時，憍陳如婆羅門說上讚歎及呪讚法，讚辯才天女已，告諸大眾：「仁等！
translation: It was then that the Kauṇḍinya Brāhmaṇa addressed the crowd after he had spoken the above praise and the Dhāraṇī praise, praising the Sarasvatī goddess, "Gentlemen!

source_sentence: 若欲請辯才天女哀愍加護，於現世中得無礙辯，聰明大智，巧妙言詞，博綜奇才，論議文飾，隨意成就無疑滯者，應當如是至誠殷重而請召言：「南謨佛陀也！
translation: If you want to ask the goddess of eloquence to kindly protect you and grant you unhindered eloquence, great intelligence, clever speech, a wide variety of abilities, and the accomplishment of discourse and ornamentation at will without doubt in the present life, you should thus sincerely and respectfully summon her, saying, "Namo Buddha!

source_sentence: 南謨達摩也！
translation: (Skt. namaḥ-dharmaja)!

source_sentence: 南謨僧伽也！
translation: (Skt. namaḥsaṃgha)!

source_sentence: 南謨諸菩薩眾、獨覺、聲聞一切賢聖！
translation: Namo bodhisattvas, solitary realizers, śrāvakas, and all sages!

source_sentence: 過去現在十方諸佛，悉皆已習真實之語，能隨順說當機實語，無虛誑語，已於無量俱胝大劫常說實語，有實語者悉皆隨喜；以不妄語故，出廣長舌能覆於面，覆贍部洲及四天下，能覆一千、二千、三千世界，普覆十方世界，圓滿周遍，不可思議，能除一切煩惱炎熱。
translation: In the past and present, the buddhas of the ten directions have all cultivated true speech, spoken real speech in accord with the situation, spoken nothing false, spoken real speech constantly for measureless incalculably long eons, and always delighted in those who spoke real speech; because they don't speak falsely, they produce a long, broad tongue that covers their faces, covers the almirate and the four worlds, covers a thousand, two thousand, or three thousand worlds, and covers the worlds in the ten directions completely and unfathomably, and is able to remove the heat of all afflictions.

source_sentence: 敬禮敬禮一切諸佛如是舌相，願我某甲皆得成就微妙辯才，至心歸命。
translation: Saluting and venerating all the buddhas with such tongues, may I, Mr. A, achieve subtle eloquence and wholeheartedly venerate them.

source_sentence: 「敬禮諸佛妙辯才，　　諸大菩薩妙辯才，　獨覺聖者妙辯才，　　四向四果妙辯才，　四聖諦語妙辯才，　　正行正見妙辯才，　梵眾諸仙妙辯才，　　大天烏摩妙辯才，　塞建陀天妙辯才，　　摩那斯王妙辯才，　聰明夜天妙辯才，　　四大天王妙辯才，　善住天子妙辯才，　　金剛密主妙辯才，　吠率怒天妙辯才，　　毘摩天女妙辯才，　侍數天神妙辯才，　　室唎天女妙辯才，　室唎末多妙辯才，　　醯哩言詞妙辯才，　諸母大母妙辯才，　　訶哩底母妙辯才，　諸藥叉神妙辯才，　　十方諸王妙辯才，　所有勝業資助我，　　令得無窮妙辯才。
translation: 「敬禮諸佛妙辯才，　　諸大菩薩妙辯才，　獨覺聖者妙辯才，　　四向四果妙辯才，　四聖諦語妙辯才，　　正行正見妙辯才，　梵眾諸仙妙辯才，　　大天烏摩妙辯才，　塞建陀天妙辯才，　　摩那斯王妙辯才，　聰明夜天妙辯才，　　四大天王妙辯才，　善住天子妙辯才，　　金剛密主妙辯才，　吠率怒天妙辯才，　　毘摩天女妙辯才，　侍數天神妙辯才，　　室唎天女妙辯才，　室唎末多妙辯才，　　醯哩言詞妙辯才，　諸母大母妙辯才，　　訶哩底母妙辯才，　諸藥叉神妙辯才，　　十方諸王妙辯才，　所有勝業資助我，　　令得無窮妙辯才。

source_sentence: 敬禮無欺誑，　　敬禮解脫者，　敬禮離欲人，　　敬禮捨纏蓋，　敬禮心清淨，　　敬禮光明者，　敬禮真實語，　　敬禮無塵習，　敬禮住勝義，　　敬禮大眾主，　敬禮辯才天，　　令我詞無礙。
translation: Venerating the absence of deception, venerating those who are liberated, venerating those who are free of desire, venerating those who are free of the hindrances of bondage, venerating those whose minds are purified, venerating those who shine, venerating true speech, venerating those without defiled habituation, venerating those who abide in the ultimate truth, venerating the lord of the people, and venerating the eloquent gods, I want my words to be unimpeded.

source_sentence: 願我所求事，　　皆悉速成就；　無病常安隱，　　壽命得延長。
translation: May all the things I seek be accomplished quickly, I'll be free of illness and always at ease, and my life will be prolonged.

source_sentence: 善解諸明呪，　　勤修菩提道；　廣饒益群生，　　求心願早遂。
translation: I'll skillfully understand the incantations, diligently cultivate the path to enlightenment, and broadly benefit all sentient beings as I seek to fulfill my aspirations early.

source_sentence: 我說真實語，　　我說無誑語；　天女妙辯才，　　令我得成就。
translation: I'll speak true words, I'll speak undeceiving words, and the goddess's marvelous eloquence will enable me to achieve them.

source_sentence: 惟願天女來，　　令我語無滯；　速入身口內，　　聰明足辯才。
translation: May the goddess come and cause my words to be unimpeded, quickly entering my body and speech with intelligence and eloquence.

source_sentence: 願令我舌根，　　當得如來辯；　由彼語威力，　　調伏諸眾生。
translation: May it be that my tongue will attain the eloquence of the Tathāgata, and because of the power of her words, I'll tame sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我所出語時，　　隨事皆成就；　聞者生恭敬，　　所作不唐捐。
translation: When I speak, whatever I do is accomplished, and those who hear it become respectful, so what I do isn't lost.

source_sentence: 若我求辯才，　　事不成就者；　天女之實語，　　皆悉成虛妄。
translation: If I sought eloquence and didn't achieve anything, the real words of the goddess would all become false.

source_sentence: 有作無間罪，　　佛語令調伏；　及以阿羅漢，　　所有報恩語。
translation: They commit instantaneous sins, which the Buddha tames with his words, and they are words of an arhat who repays kindness.

source_sentence: 舍利子目連，　　世尊眾第一；　斯等真實語，　　願我皆成就。
translation: Śāriputra Maitreya, the Bhagavān is the best of many; may these true words be fulfilled by me.

source_sentence: 我今皆召請，　　佛之聲聞眾，　皆願速來至，　　成就我求心，　所求真實語，　　皆願無虛誑。
translation: Now, I've summoned a multitude of śrāvakas, all of whom wish to come quickly, to fulfill my intention to seek, and all of them wish for true words that aren't false.

source_sentence: 上從色究竟，　　及以淨居天，　大梵及梵輔，　　一切梵王眾，　乃至遍三千，　　索訶世界主，　并及諸眷屬，　　我今皆請召；　惟願降慈悲，　　哀憐同攝受。
translation: From the highest of form and the lowest of form, to the pure abode gods, Brahmā and Brahmā's assistants, all the Brahma kings, up to the 3,000, the lords of the sohā world, and their retinues, I now summon them all, wishing to subdue their compassion and kindly accept them all together.

source_sentence: 他化自在天，　　及以樂變化；　覩史多天眾，　　慈氏當成佛。
translation: The gods of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin Heaven and the gods of Tuṣita, Maitreya will become buddhas.

source_sentence: 夜摩諸天眾，　　及三十三天；　四大王眾天，　　一切諸天眾。
translation: The Yama gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the four great king gods, and all the gods.

source_sentence: 地水火風神，　　依妙高山住；　七海山神眾，　　所有諸眷屬。
translation: The gods of earth, water, fire, and wind stand on a high, marvelous mountain, and the gods of the seven seas and mountains are all their retinues.

source_sentence: 滿財及五頂，　　日月諸星辰；　如是諸天眾，　　令世間安隱。
translation: Possessing wealth and the five peaks, the sun and moon, and the stars, these gods make the world peaceful.

source_sentence: 斯等諸天神，　　不樂作罪業；　敬禮鬼子母，　　及最小愛兒。
translation: These gods don't enjoy doing evil deeds, and they revere the mothers of ghosts and children and the youngest beloved child.

source_sentence: 天龍藥叉眾，　　乾闥阿蘇羅，　及以緊那羅，　　莫呼洛伽等。
translation: They are the gods, the dragons, the yakṣas, the gandharvas, the kiṃnaras, the mahoragas, and so forth.

source_sentence: 我以世尊力，　　悉皆申請召；　願降慈悲心，　　與我無礙辯。
translation: By the power of the Bhagavān, I summoned them all, wishing to summon a compassionate heart and give me unhindered discernment.

source_sentence: 一切人天眾，　　能了他心者；　皆願加神力，　　與我妙辯才。
translation: May all the multitudes of humans and gods who understand the minds of others apply their spiritual powers and give me their marvelous eloquence.

source_sentence: 乃至盡虛空，　　周遍於法界；　所有含生類，　　與我妙辯才。」
translation: Even to the end of space, they completely pervade the Dharma realm, and all living beings share my marvelous eloquence."

source_sentence: 爾時，辯才天女聞是請已，告婆羅門言：「善哉！
translation: After hearing this request, the Sarasvatī goddess addressed the Brāhmaṇa, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有男子女人能依如是呪及呪讚，如前所說受持法式，歸敬三寶，虔心正念，於所求事，皆不唐捐，兼復受持讀誦此《金光明》微妙經典，所願求者，無不果遂，速得成就，除不至心。」
translation: If a man or woman can follow this dhāraṇī and its praises, accept the Dharma formula as explained, revere the Three Treasures, be reverent and correctly mindful, and do whatever is sought, as well as accept and recite this exquisite scripture of Golden Light, none of their desires will be fulfilled, and they'll quickly attain them, except for those who don't reach their hearts."

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，深心歡喜，合掌頂受。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then rejoiced profoundly and bowed his palms in acceptance.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告辯才天女：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the Sarasvatī goddess, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 善女天！
translation: Sarasvatī!

source_sentence: 汝能流布是妙經王，擁護所有受持經者，及能利益一切眾生，令得安樂，說如是法，施與辯才不可思議，得福無量，諸發心者速趣菩提。」
translation: You can disseminate this wonderful sūtra king, protect all those who accept and uphold it, benefit all sentient beings, bring about happiness, expound such teachings, bestow unfathomable eloquence, and obtain immeasurable merit, so that those who have set their minds to it will quickly reach enlightenment."

source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經大吉祥天女品第十
translation: Jin guangming zuishengwang jingda jixiang diannü pin x

source_sentence: 六
translation: six

source_sentence: 爾時，大吉祥天女即從座起，前禮佛足，合掌恭敬，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the great auspicious goddess rose from her seat, bowed her head at the Buddha's feet, put her palms together in respect, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我若見有苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦，受持讀誦，為人解說是《金光明最勝王經》者，我當專心恭敬供養此等法師，所謂飲食、衣服、臥具、醫藥，及餘一切所須資具，皆令圓滿無有乏少。
translation: "If I see a monk, monk's nun, upāsaka, or upāsikā who memorizes, recites, and explains this Sutra of King Golden Light, I will devote my mind to respecting and supporting these teachers, so that their food, clothing, bedding, medicine, and all other necessities will be complete and not lacking.

source_sentence: 若晝若夜於此經王所有句義，觀察思量，安樂而住，令此經典於贍部洲廣行流布，為彼有情已於無量百千佛所種善根者，常使得聞，不速隱沒。
translation: Whether day or night, I'll examine and deliberate on the phrases and meanings of this sūtra king, abide in comfort, and cause this sūtra to spread far and wide on the Jambudvīpa continent, so that those sentient beings who have planted good roots in measureless hundreds of thousands of buddhas will always hear it and won't be quickly sunken into obscurity.

source_sentence: 復於無量百千億劫，當受人天種種勝樂，常得豐稔，永除飢饉，一切有情恒受安樂，亦得值遇諸佛世尊，於未來世速證無上大菩提果，永絕三塗輪迴苦難。
translation: Furthermore, in measureless hundreds of millions of eons, they'll experience various kinds of superior happiness in humans and gods, always have an abundance of food, and never experience hunger, and all sentient beings will always experience well-being and meet the buddhas and world-honored ones, quickly realize the unsurpassed fruit of great enlightenment in the future, and permanently end the suffering of the three destinies of transmigration.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我念過去有琉璃金山寶花光照吉祥功德海如來、應、正等覺，十號具足，我於彼所種諸善根，由彼如來慈悲愍念威神力故，令我今日隨所念處、隨所視方、隨所至國，能令無量百千萬億眾生受諸快樂，乃至所須衣服飲食資生之具，金銀、琉璃、車璩、瑪瑙、珊瑚、虎珀、真珠等寶悉令充足；若復有人至心讀誦是《金光明最勝王經》，亦當日日燒眾名香及諸妙花，為我供養彼琉璃金山寶花光照吉祥功德海如來、應、正等覺，復當每日於三時中稱念我名，別以香花及諸美食供養於我，亦常聽受此妙經王，得如是福。」
translation: I remembered that in the past there was a Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Enlightened One who had planted good roots in that place, and it was because of the Tathāgata's compassionate, benevolent, and authoritative power that today, wherever I think, wherever I look, and wherever I go, I can cause measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of sentient beings to experience various pleasures, even necessities such as clothing and food, necessities for livelihood, and treasures such as gold, silver, lapis lazuli, carabao, onyx, coral, tiger pearl, and genuine pearl to be abundant.

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「由能如是持經故，　　自身眷屬離諸衰；　所須衣食無乏時，　　威光壽命難窮盡。
translation: He spoke this verse, "Because they thus maintain the sūtras, their retinue is freed from decay, their necessary clothing and food are never lacking, and their resplendent life is difficult to exhaust.

source_sentence: 能令地味常增長，　　諸天降雨隨時節；　令諸天眾咸歡悅，　　及以園林穀果神。
translation: It always produces a greater taste for the earth, rains down from the gods at regular intervals, and causes the gods to rejoice, along with the gods of the forest and the fruits of the harvest.

source_sentence: 叢林果樹並滋榮，　　所有苗稼咸成就；　欲求珍財皆滿願，　　隨所念者遂其心。」
translation: The groves and fruit trees flourish together, and all the crops are produced; their desires for precious treasures are fulfilled, and their thoughts are fulfilled according to their desires."

source_sentence: 佛告大吉祥天女：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha told the great auspicious goddess, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝能如是憶念昔因，報恩供養，利益安樂無邊眾生，流布是經，功德無盡。」
translation: If you can thus remember past causes, repay kindnesses and offerings, benefit and comfort limitless sentient beings, and disseminate this sūtra, your merit will be inexhaustible."

source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經大吉祥天女增長財
translation: Sutra of Golden Light, the Foremost King, and the Great Auspicious Goddess, Growing Wealth

source_sentence: 物品第十七
translation: seventeenth in the category of possessions

source_sentence: 爾時，大吉祥天女復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Great Auspicious Goddess again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 北方薜室羅末拏天王城名有財，去城不遠，有園名曰妙華福光，中有勝殿，七寶所成。
translation: In the northern city of Vaiśravaṇa, the god king's city is called Aśvaghoṣa, and not far from there there is a park called Māravaraprabha, which contains a wonderful hall made of seven treasures.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我常住彼。
translation: "I'll always stay there.

source_sentence: 若復有人欲求五穀日日增多、倉庫盈溢者，應當發起敬信之心，淨治一室，瞿摩塗地，應畫我像，種種瓔珞周匝莊嚴；當洗浴身，著淨衣服，塗以名香，入淨室內，發心為我每日三時稱彼佛名及此經名號而申禮敬：『南謨琉璃金山寶花光照吉祥功德海如來！』
translation: If another person wishes to have their grains increase day by day and their storehouse overflow, they should arouse respect and faith, purify a room, paint the floor with gomat, paint my image, adorn it with various kinds of jewelry, wash their body, put on clean clothing, apply a well-known scent, go into a clean room, and venerate the Buddha's name and the name of this sūtra with the intention of calling them by their name three times a day, 'Tathāgata of the auspicious ocean of merit that shines from the jeweled flowers of the southern beryl mountains!'

source_sentence: 持諸香花及以種種甘美飲食，至心奉獻，亦以香花及諸飲食供養我像；復持飲食，散擲餘方，施諸神等，實言邀請大吉祥天，發所求願：『若如所言是不虛者，於我所請，勿令空爾。』
translation: She wholeheartedly offered flowers and various kinds of sweet food, offered flowers and food to my image, scattered food and drink in other directions, gave it to the spirits, and truly invited the great auspicious gods with the words, "If what they say is true, don't let my request be in vain."

source_sentence: 于時吉祥天女，知是事已，便生愍念，令其宅中財穀增長。
translation: Knowing this, the auspicious goddess then became compassionate and kind, causing the wealth in her house to grow.

source_sentence: 即當誦呪請召於我，先稱佛名及菩薩名字，一心敬禮：「南謨一切十方三世諸佛　南謨寶髻佛　南謨無垢光明寶幢佛　南謨金幢光佛　南謨百金光藏佛　南謨金蓋寶積佛　南謨金花光幢佛　南謨大燈光佛　南謨大寶幢佛　南謨東方不動佛　南謨南方寶幢佛　南謨西方無量壽佛　南謨北方天鼓音王佛　南謨妙幢菩薩　南謨金光菩薩　南謨金藏菩薩　南謨常啼菩薩　南謨法上菩薩　南謨善安菩薩「敬禮如是佛菩薩已，次當誦呪請召我大吉祥天女。
translation: 即當誦呪請召於我，先稱佛名及菩薩名字，一心敬禮：「南謨一切十方三世諸佛　南謨寶髻佛　南謨無垢光明寶幢佛　南謨金幢光佛　南謨百金光藏佛　南謨金蓋寶積佛　南謨金花光幢佛　南謨大燈光佛　南謨大寶幢佛　南謨東方不動佛　南謨南方寶幢佛　南謨西方無量壽佛　南謨北方天鼓音王佛　南謨妙幢菩薩　南謨金光菩薩　南謨金藏菩薩　南謨常啼菩薩　南謨法上菩薩　南謨善安菩薩「敬禮如是佛菩薩已，次當誦呪請召我大吉祥天女。

source_sentence: 由此呪力，所求之事皆得成就。」
translation: By the power of this dhāraṇī, whatever you seek will be accomplished."

source_sentence: 即說呪曰：「南謨室唎莫訶天女　怛姪他　鉢唎脯[口*律]拏折囇　三曼[多*頁]　達喇設泥(去聲，下皆同爾)莫訶毘訶囉揭諦　三曼哆毘曇末泥　莫訶迦哩也　鉢喇底瑟侘鉢泥　薩婆頞　他娑彈泥　蘇鉢喇底晡囇　[序-予+阿]耶娜達摩多莫訶毘俱比諦　莫訶迷咄嚕　鄔波僧呬羝　莫訶頡唎使　蘇僧近(入聲)哩呬羝　三曼多頞他　阿奴波喇泥　莎訶「世尊！
translation: He then recited the spell, "Nanmośrī Mahādeva, the goddess Taninta, Pāriyāprabhāsa, Samantabhadra, Darāśīnī, Mahāvihāragadī, Samantabhadra, Mahākāliyā, Pratibhāna, Sarvâstivāda, Sātasāda, Subhṛthivāda, [preface - yo + a] Yana, Dharmadatta, Mahāvijubhitī, Mahāmāyānī, Upāsāṃghika, Mahājerī, Samantabhadra, Anupālānī, and Śākha, the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若人誦持如是神呪請召我時，我聞請已，即至其所，令願得遂。
translation: When someone recites such a divine spell and summons me, I hear the invitation and go to them, causing the wish to be fulfilled.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是灌頂法句，定成就句，真實之句，無虛誑句，是平等行，於諸眾生是正善根。
translation: These are the words of the consecration, the words of accomplishment of concentration, the true words, and the words that are not false, which are equal in practice and are rightly beneficial to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若有受持讀誦呪者，應七日七夜受八支戒，於晨朝時先嚼齒木淨澡漱已，及於晡後香花供養一切諸佛，自陳其罪。
translation: If someone memorizes and recites the dhāraṇī, they should take the eight precepts for seven days and nights, cleanse themselves by chewing wood with teeth in the morning and rinse themselves after sunrise, and then offer incense and flowers to all the buddhas in the afternoon to present their faults.

source_sentence: 當為己身及諸含識迴向發願，令所悕求速得成就。
translation: He should dedicate himself and the implied consciousnesses to the vow that what he seeks will be quickly accomplished.

source_sentence: 淨治一室，或在空閑阿蘭若處，瞿摩為壇，燒栴檀香，而為供養。
translation: Purify a room or place it in a deserted forest or araṇya, make a gomaya altar, burn sandalwood incense, and make offerings.

source_sentence: 置一勝座，幡蓋莊嚴，以諸名花布列壇內，應當至心誦持前呪，悕望我至。
translation: Place a seat that's especially beautiful, adorned with banners and shrouds, and spread flowers of renown on the altar, and recite the preceding dhāraṇī with all your heart, hoping for my arrival.

source_sentence: 我於爾時即便護念觀察是人，來入其室，就座而坐，受其供養。
translation: At that point, I'll even protect and observe that person, enter their room, sit down on their seat, and accept their offerings.

source_sentence: 從是以後，當令彼人於睡夢中得見於我，隨所求事以實告知。
translation: From then on, I'll cause that person to see me in their sleep and dream and tell them the truth about whatever they seek.

source_sentence: 若聚落空澤及僧住處，隨所求者，皆令圓滿，金銀財寶、牛羊穀麥、飲食衣服，皆得隨心受諸快樂。
translation: If there's a village, an empty swamp, or a residence for a priest, whatever he asks for will be fulfilled, and he'll receive the pleasure of gold, silver, treasure, cattle, sheep, grain, and clothing as he wishes.

source_sentence: 既得如是勝妙果報，當以上分供養三寶，及施於我，廣修法會，設諸飲食，布列香花。
translation: Once they have attained such a wonderful result, they will make the above-mentioned offerings to the three treasures, bestow them on themselves, cultivate Dharma gatherings, prepare meals, and spread out flowers and incense.

source_sentence: 既供養已，所有供養貨之取直，復為供養。
translation: After making these offerings, I'll take all the offerings and make straightforward offerings to them again.

source_sentence: 我當終身常住於此，擁護是人，令無闕乏，隨所悕求，悉皆稱意。
translation: I will always stay here for the rest of my life, protecting this person so that there's nothing lacking and fulfilling all of their desires as they arise.

source_sentence: 亦當時時給濟貧乏，不應慳惜，獨為己身。
translation: I'll also give aid to the poor at the time and not be stingy about it, but I'll take it for myself alone.

source_sentence: 常讀是經，供養不絕，當以此福普施一切，迴向菩提，願出生死，速得解脫。」
translation: Always reading this sūtra and making offerings without stopping, you will universally bestow this merit on all people, dedicate it to enlightenment, and vow to escape birth-and-death and quickly attain liberation."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊讚言：「善哉！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān praised him, "Good!

source_sentence: 吉祥天女！
translation: Auspicious Goddess!

source_sentence: 汝能如是流布此經，不可思議，自他俱益。」
translation: Your ability to thus disseminate this sūtra is inconceivable and will benefit both yourself and others."

source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經堅牢地神品第十八
translation: Jin guangming zuishengwang jing jianluodi shen pin di xviii

source_sentence: 爾時，堅牢地神即於眾中，從座而起，合掌恭敬而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the Pṛthivī god Kālôdayin rose from his seat among the crowd, put his palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是《金光明最勝王經》，若現在世，若未來世，若在城邑聚落、王宮樓觀，及阿蘭若、山澤空林，有此經王流布之處，世尊！
translation: "If this is the Sutra of Golden Light, Most Excellent King, and if there are places in the present or future world where this king of scriptures spreads in cities, towns, villages, royal palaces, mansions, forested mountains, or seas, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我當往詣其所，供養恭敬擁護流通。
translation: I will go to that place, make offerings, honor, embrace, and circulate it.

source_sentence: 若有方處為說法師敷置高座演說經
translation: If there's a place where a Dharma preacher spreads out a high seat and explains the sūtras, then I'll go there and make offerings, respectfully embrace them, and circulate them.

source_sentence: 者，我以神力不現本身，在於座所，頂戴其足；我得聞法，深心歡喜，得飡法味，增益威光，慶悅無量。
translation: "When I myself am unseen by miraculous powers, I sit at my seat and stand on my feet, deeply rejoicing when I hear the teaching, relish the taste of the teaching, increase my radiance, and rejoice immeasurably.

source_sentence: 自身既得如是利益，亦令大地深十六萬八千踰繕那，至金剛輪際，令其地味悉皆增益，乃至四海所有土地，亦使肥濃田疇沃壤倍勝常日。
translation: Since I myself have attained such a benefit, I've also caused the earth to reach a depth of 168,000 yojanas to the limit of the vajra wheel, which has increased the taste of the ground, and I've made the land in the four seas twice as fertile as it always is.

source_sentence: 亦復令此贍部洲中江河池沼，所有諸樹藥草叢林，種種花果根莖枝葉及諸苗稼，形相可愛，眾所樂觀，色香具足，皆堪受用。
translation: It also causes the rivers and ponds of Jambudvīpa and its groves of medicinal plants, various flowers and fruits, roots, stems, leaves, and crops to be pleasing in appearance, desirable in many ways, and full of color and fragrance, all of which are suitable for use.

source_sentence: 若諸有情受用如是勝飲食已，長命色力，諸根安隱，增益光輝，無諸痛惱，心慧勇健，無不堪能。
translation: If sentient beings take advantage of such excellent food, they'll have long life, color, strength, peaceful faculties, increased radiance, freedom from pain, and mental wisdom that's bold and robust, with no incapacity.

source_sentence: 又此大地凡有所須，百千事業悉皆周備。
translation: Whatever this great land needs, it's fully supplied with a hundred thousand undertakings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是因緣，諸贍部洲安隱豐樂，人民熾盛，無諸衰惱，所有眾生皆受安樂。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, the jambū continents are peaceful and abundant, their people flourish, and there's no discomfort, and all sentient beings experience well-being.

source_sentence: 既受如是身心快樂，於此經王深加愛敬，所在之處皆願受持供養，恭敬尊重讚歎。
translation: Since they experience such physical and mental happiness, they deeply love and respect the king of these sūtras, and wherever they are, they want to accept, support, respect, honor, and praise him.

source_sentence: 又復於彼說法大師法座之處，悉皆往彼，為諸眾生勸請說是最勝經王。
translation: They also go to the place where the Dharma lecturer sits on his Dharma throne and encourage sentient beings to recite this most excellent sūtra for the king.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 由說此經，我之自身并諸眷屬咸蒙利益，光輝氣力，勇猛威勢，顏容端正，倍勝於常。
translation: As a result of speaking this sūtra, I've benefited myself and my retinue with radiant energy, courage, and dignity of countenance that are twice as great as usual.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我堅牢地神蒙法味已，令贍部洲縱廣七千踰繕那地，皆悉沃壤乃至如前，所有眾生皆受安樂。
translation: After I, the Kālôdayin, have been enlightened by the taste of the Dharma, I will cause the land of Jambudvīpa, which is 7,000 yojanas wide, to be fertile and even as before, so that all sentient beings will experience well-being.

source_sentence: 是故，世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時彼眾生為報我恩，應作是念：『我當必定聽受是經，恭敬供養，尊重讚歎。』
translation: In order to repay my kindness, those sentient beings should think, 'I will surely listen to and accept this sūtra, venerate it, make offerings, and praise it with respect.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即從住處城邑聚落、舍宅空地，詣法會所，頂禮法師，聽受是經。
translation: After they think this, they then go from their residence in a town, village, or an empty house to the Dharma assembly, pay homage to the Dharma teacher, and listen to and accept this sūtra.

source_sentence: 既聽受已，各還本處，心生慶喜，共作是言：『我等今者得聞甚深無上妙法，即是攝受不可思議功德之聚，由經力故，我等當值無量無邊百千俱胝那庾多佛，承事供養，永離三塗極苦之處，復於來世百千生中，常生天上，及在人間受諸勝樂。』
translation: After listening and accepting it, they each returned to their original place, rejoiced, and said together, 'Now, we've heard the profound, unsurpassed, and wonderful teaching, which is a collection of unfathomable merit, and because of the power of the sūtras, we will meet measureless and limitless hundreds of thousands of Kārttika Nayuta buddhas, serve and make offerings to them, permanently escape the three destinies of extreme suffering, and in a hundred thousand more lifetimes to be permanently born up in heaven and enjoy surpassing pleasures here among humans.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸人各還本處，為諸人眾說是經王，若一喻、一品、一昔因緣、一如來名、一菩薩名、一四句頌、或復一句，為諸眾生說是經典，乃至首題名字。
translation: Each of those people then returned to his original place and spoke this sūtra for the multitude of people, whether it was a parable, a class, a past cause and condition, the name of the Tathāgata, the name of a bodhisattva, a four-line verse, or even a sentence, and explained this sūtra for the sentient beings, even down to its initial title.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 隨諸眾生所住之處，其地悉皆沃壤肥濃，過於餘處。
translation: Wherever sentient beings live, the ground is always fertile and thicker than any other place.

source_sentence: 凡是土地所生之物，悉得增長滋茂廣大，令諸眾生受於快樂，多饒珍財，好行惠施，心常堅固，深信三寶。」
translation: Whatever that land produces will all grow and flourish, causing sentient beings to experience joy, proliferate treasures, do good gifts, and remain resolute in their minds and faith in the Three Treasures."

source_sentence: 作是語已，爾時，世尊告堅牢地神曰：「若有眾生，聞是《金光明》最勝經王乃至一句，命終之後，當得往生三十三天及餘天處。
translation: After making these remarks, the Bhagavān then addressed the Pṛthivī god Firmament, "If sentient beings hear this most excellent sūtra, King Golden Light, even its single phrase, they will be reborn in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and other heavens when their lives end.

source_sentence: 若有眾生為欲供養是經王故，莊嚴宅宇，乃至張一傘蓋、懸一繒幡，由是因緣，六天之上，如念受生，七寶妙宮，隨意受用，各各自然有七千天女，共相娛樂，日夜常受不可思議殊勝之樂。」
translation: If a sentient being wishes to make offerings to this sūtra king and adorn their residence, even to the point of spreading an umbrella and hanging a silken banner, as a result of this, they'll be born as they think about it up in the six heavens, have access to seven precious and marvelous palaces at their disposal, and naturally have 7,000 goddesses in each of them to entertain them and provide inconceivable and extraordinary pleasure day and night."

source_sentence: 作是語已，爾時，堅牢地神白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After he said this, the firmament god then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是因緣，若有四眾，昇於法座，說是法時，我當晝夜擁護是人，自隱其身在於座所，頂戴其足。
translation: Because of this, if four people were to ascend to the Dharma seat and expound the teaching, I would guard that person day and night, hide myself in his seat, and carry his feet on my head.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是經典為彼眾生已於百千佛所種善根者，於贍部洲流布不滅。
translation: Such a sūtra is for those sentient beings who have planted good roots in one hundred thousand buddha-places and spread them throughout the Jambudvīpa continent without ceasing to exist.

source_sentence: 是諸眾生聽斯經者，於未來世無量百千俱胝那庾多劫，天上人中常受勝樂，得遇諸佛，速成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，不歷三塗生死之苦。」
translation: When sentient beings listen to this sūtra, they'll experience an infinite number of hundreds of thousands of koṭīnayuṭas in the future, always experience great happiness up in heaven or among humans, meet the buddhas, quickly achieve unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and not experience the three destinies of birth-and-death."

source_sentence: 爾時，堅牢地神白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the Pṛthivī god said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我有心呪，能利人天，安樂一切，若有男子女人及諸四眾，欲得親見我真身者，應當至心持此陀羅尼，隨其所願，皆悉遂心，所謂資財珍寶伏藏，及求神通，長年妙藥并療眾病，降伏怨敵，制諸異論。
translation: "I have a mental dhāraṇī that will benefit humans and gods and bring comfort to all of them. If men, women, or any of the four groups of people want to see my true body for themselves, they should wholeheartedly hold this dhāraṇī and follow their wishes, which are to lay up treasures, seek spiritual powers, administer wonderful medicines for years, treat illnesses, subdue enemies, and suppress non-Buddhist beliefs.

source_sentence: 當於淨室安置道場，洗浴身已，著鮮潔衣，踞草座上，於有舍利尊像之前，或有舍利制底之所，燒香散花，飲食供養。
translation: They should set up their site of enlightenment in a clean room, wash themselves, put on fresh robes, and sit on a grass throne in front of an image of Venerable Śāriputra or a place where Śāriputra's body is made, burn incense and scatter flowers, and offer food and drink.

source_sentence: 於白月八日布灑星合，即可誦此請召之呪：「怛姪他只哩只哩　主嚕主嚕　句嚕句嚕　拘柱拘柱　覩柱覩柱　縛訶(上)　縛訶　伐捨伐捨　莎訶「世尊！
translation: On the eighth day of the white moon, he spreads out a combination of stars and recites this invocation spell, "Tāmaṇḍa-jñānaliputra, turuṣka-juruṣka-juruṣka, kuṣka-juruṣka, turuṣka-juruṣka, vāha (above), vāha, vāsya, vāsya, and sahā, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此之神呪，若有四眾，誦一百八遍請召於我，我為是人即來赴請。
translation: If these four groups of people recite this dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times and summon me, I'll come to them for them.

source_sentence: 又復，世尊！
translation: Again, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有眾生欲得見我現身共語者，亦應如前安置法式，誦此神呪：「怛姪他　頞折泥(去)頡力剎泥室尼達哩訶訶呬呬區嚕　伐囇　莎訶「世尊！
translation: If there are sentient beings who want to see and speak with me in person, they should also recite this dhāraṇī in the same manner as the preceding one: "Tāmaṇeta, Añjñāta, Jaiḍānī, Śanīdhari, Haha, Frehū, Kuru, Vātsī, and Sahā, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若人持此呪時，應誦一百八遍，并誦前呪，我必現身，隨其所願，悉得成就，終不虛然。
translation: If someone recites this dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times and recites the preceding dhāraṇī, I will definitely manifest myself and grant whatever they desire, and it will never be in vain.

source_sentence: 若欲誦此呪時，先誦護身呪曰：「怛姪他儞室里末捨羯[打-丁+致]　捺[打-丁+致]矩[打-丁+致]　勃地(上)　勃地囇　婢[打-丁+致]婢[打-丁+致]　矩句[打-丁+致]　佉婆(上)只里　莎訶「世尊！
translation: When you want to recite this dhāraṇī, first recite the body-protecting dhāraṇī, saying, "Tameinta-needle, śrīmaśakal [hit-tin+zhi], nad [hit-tin+zhi], ku [hit-tin+zhi], buddi (above), buddi (above), slave [hit-tin+zhi], slave [hit-tin+zhi], ku [hit-tin+zhi], khava (above), and sahā, 'Bhagavān!'

source_sentence: 誦此呪時，取五色線，誦呪二十一遍，作二十一結，繫在左臂肘後，即便護身，無有所懼。
translation: When you recite this dhāraṇī, take a five-colored thread, recite the dhāraṇī twenty-one times, make twenty-one knots, and tie it behind your left elbow, so that you can protect yourself and have no fear.

source_sentence: 若有至心誦此呪者，所求必遂，我不妄語，我以佛法僧寶而為要契證知是實。」
translation: If someone wholeheartedly recites this dhāraṇī, their request will surely be fulfilled; I won't lie; I'll make the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha the essential way to realize this truth."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告地神曰：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the earth spirit, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝能以是實語神呪，護此經王及說法者，以是因緣令汝獲得無量福報。」
translation: If you can protect the king of this sūtra and its Dharma preacher with this truly spoken divine spell, by these causes and conditions you'll attain immeasurable rewards of merit."

source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經僧慎爾耶藥叉大將
translation: Sutra of King Golden Light Most Excellent, General Sengshenyi Yakṣa

source_sentence: 品第十九
translation: the nineteenth rank of the class

source_sentence: 爾時，僧慎爾耶藥叉大將，并與二十八部藥叉諸神，於大眾中皆從座起，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合掌向佛白言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, the great general of the Yakṣas of Saṃsāṃnīya and the twenty-eight Yakṣa deities rose from their seats in the assembly, bared their right shoulders, knelt on their right knees, put their palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此《金光明》最勝經王，若現在世及未來世，所在宣揚流布之處，若於城邑聚落、山澤空林，或王宮殿或僧住處，世尊！
translation: Bhagavān! Where does this most excellent sūtra, the King of Golden Light, proclaim and disseminate in the present and future worlds, whether in a town, a village, a mountain swamp, an empty forest, a king's palace, or a monk's dwelling place?

source_sentence: 我僧慎爾耶藥叉大將，并與二十八部藥叉諸神俱詣其所，各自隱形，隨處擁護彼說法師，令離衰惱，常受安樂。
translation: We, the great general of the Yakṣas of Saṃsāṃnīya, along with 28 Yakṣa deities of the Yakṣas, went to his place, each took his own form, and went around supporting that Dharma preacher, freeing him from misfortune and always enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 及聽法者，若男若女，童男童女，於此經中乃至受持一四句頌，或持一句，或此經王首題名號，及此經中一如來名，一菩薩名，發心稱念，恭敬供養者，我當救護攝受，令無災橫，離苦得樂。
translation: If a man, woman, or boy or girl who listens to the teaching in this sūtra even accepts a four-line verse, or if he accepts a single line, or if he accepts the name of the king of this sūtra's title, or if he accepts the name of Rilai or the name of a bodhisattva in this sūtra, I will rescue and accept them, making them free of trouble and free from suffering and attaining happiness.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何故我名正了知？
translation: Why is it that I am called correct knowledge?

source_sentence: 此之因緣，是佛親證，我知諸法，我曉一切法，隨所有一切法，如所有一切法，諸法種類體性差別，世尊！
translation: This is the cause and condition for the Buddha personally realizing that I know all dharmas, that I know all dharmas, that I understand all dharmas as they are, and that there are distinctions in the nature of various dharmas, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是諸法，我能了知。
translation: "Thus, I can comprehend these things.

source_sentence: 我有難思智光，我有難思智炬，我有難思智行，我有難思智聚，我於難思智境而能通達。
translation: I have the light of inconceivable knowledge, I have the torch of inconceivable knowledge, I have the practice of inconceivable knowledge, I have the cluster of inconceivable knowledge, and I'm able to comprehend the objects of inconceivable knowledge.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如我於一切法，正知正曉正覺，能正觀察。
translation: "As I am, I correctly know, understand, and awaken to all things, and I'm able to correctly examine them.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是因緣，我藥叉大將名正了知。
translation: For this reason, I, the Yakṣa General, am called a correct comprehender.

source_sentence: 以是義故，我能令彼說法之師，言詞辯了，具足莊嚴，亦令精氣從毛孔入，身力充足，威神勇健，難思智光皆得成就，得正憶念，無有退屈，增益彼身，令無衰減，諸根安樂，常生歡喜。
translation: Because of this, I can cause that Dharma preacher to be eloquent and fully adorned in speech, cause vital energy to enter through his pores, make his body and mind full of strength, be courageous in spirit, achieve the accomplishment of the radiance of inconceivable knowledge, attain right recollection without retrogressing, enhance his body so that it doesn't fade, and make his faculties comfortable and always produce joy.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，為彼有情，已於百千佛所植諸善根修福業者，於贍部洲廣宣流布，不速隱沒。
translation: Because of this, those sentient beings for whom these good roots have been planted in a hundred thousand Buddha-places and whose meritorious actions have been cultivated will have them widely disseminated on the Jambudvīpa continent, where they won't soon disappear.

source_sentence: 彼諸有情聞是經已，得不可思議大智光明，及以無量福智之聚，於未來世，當受無量俱胝那庾多劫不可思量人天勝樂，常與諸佛共相值遇，速證無上正等菩提，閻羅之界三塗極苦，不復經過。」
translation: After hearing this sūtra, those sentient beings will attain unfathomably great illumination of wisdom and an immeasurable stock of merit and wisdom, and in the future they will experience unfathomably great human and divine happiness for an incalculably long time, always meet the buddhas together, quickly realize unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment, and never again pass through the three destinies of suffering in the realm of Yama."

source_sentence: 爾時，正了知藥叉大將白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the great general Yakṣa who knew correctly said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我有陀羅尼，今對佛前親自陳說，為欲饒益憐愍諸有情故。」
translation: I have a dhāraṇī that I've explained to the Buddha in person for the purpose of benefiting and pitying sentient beings."

source_sentence: 此之明呪有大威力，若誦呪時，我當速至其所，令無障礙，隨意成就。
translation: This incantation has great power, and when I recite it, I'll quickly go to them and make them available without obstruction, as I wish.

source_sentence: 若持此呪時，應知其法，先畫一鋪僧慎爾耶藥叉形像，高四五尺，手執鉾鑹，於此像前作四方壇，安四滿瓶蜜水，或沙糖水，塗香粖香燒香及諸花鬘。
translation: When you recite this dhāraṇī, you should know the procedure. First, you should draw a four- or five-foot-tall image of Saṃsāṃnīya Yakṣa holding a spear in his hand, build a four-square altar in front of the image, place four full bottles of honeyed water or sugar water, rub incense on it, burn incense, and put flower garlands on it.

source_sentence: 又於壇前作地火爐，中安炭火，以蘇摩芥子燒於爐中，口誦前呪一百八遍，一遍一燒。
translation: In front of the altar, he makes a fireplace with a charcoal fire in it and burns sumac seeds in it, reciting the preceding dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times orally, burning them once.

source_sentence: 乃至我藥叉大將自來現身，問呪人曰：『爾何所須？
translation: I, Yakṣa the General, appeared in person and asked the person who did the incantation, 'What do you need?'

source_sentence: 意所求者？』
translation: What do you want?'

source_sentence: 即以事答，我即隨言於所求事皆令滿足。
translation: "He then answers with a question, "I will fulfill whatever he asks for, as I say.

source_sentence: 或須金銀及諸伏藏，或欲神仙乘空而去，或求天眼通，或知他心事，於一切有情隨意自在，令斷煩惱，速得解脫，皆得成就。」
translation: Whether they need gold or silver or other hidden treasures, want immortals to ride off into the sky, seek the divine vision, or know the thoughts of others, they'll accomplish whatever they want for all sentient beings, causing them to end affliction and quickly attain liberation."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告正了知藥叉大將曰：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Yakṣa general, who had correct knowledge, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝能如是利益一切眾生，說此神呪，擁護正法，福利無邊。」
translation: You can thus benefit all sentient beings by reciting this divine spell, upholding the true teaching and providing limitless benefits."

source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經王法正論品第二十
translation: Jin guangming zuishengwang jingwang fazheng lun pin xx

source_sentence: 爾時，此大地神女，名曰堅牢，於大眾中，從座而起，頂禮佛足，合掌恭敬白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, this earth goddess named Kālôdayin rose from her seat in the assembly, bowed her head at the Buddha's feet, put her palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於諸國中為人王者，若無正法，不能治國安養眾生，及以自身長居勝位；惟願世尊慈悲哀愍，當為我說王法正論治國之要，令諸人王得聞法已，如說修行，正化於世，能令勝位永保安寧，國內人民咸蒙利益。」
translation: If human kings in various countries didn't have the right teaching, they wouldn't be able to govern their countries, support sentient beings, or maintain their own positions of superiority for long. May the Bhagavān have compassion and mercy as he teaches me the right teaching for kings and the correct theory of the essentials for governing a country, so that after hearing the teaching, human kings will practice it according to its explanation and correctly transform the world, making their positions of superiority permanently secure and peaceful, and the people within their countries will all benefit."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於大眾中，告堅牢地神曰：「汝當諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Pṛthivī god Firmament in the midst of the crowd, "Listen closely!

source_sentence: 過去有王，名力尊幢，其王有子，名曰妙幢，受灌頂位未久之頃，爾時父王告妙幢言：『有王法正論，名天主教法，我於昔時受灌頂位而為國主，我之父王，名智力尊幢，為我說是王法正論。
translation: Not long before he was consecrated, his father told him, 'There's a correct theory of the king's teaching called the Catholic teaching, and when I was consecrated and became lord of the kingdom, my father, the man named Dignāga, taught me this correct theory of the king's teaching.

source_sentence: 我依此論，於二萬歲善治國土，我不曾憶起一念心行於非法，汝於今日亦應如是，勿以非法而治於國。
translation: I relied on this treatise to rule the land well for 20,000 years, and I don't recall a single thought of my mind acting unlawfully.

source_sentence: 云何名為王法正論？
translation: What is called the correct theory of the king's teaching?

source_sentence: 汝今善聽，當為汝說。』
translation: Now, listen well, and I will explain it for you.'

source_sentence: 爾時力尊幢王，即為其子以妙伽他說正論曰：「『我說王法論，　　利安諸有情；　　為斷世間疑，　　滅除眾過失。
translation: It was then that the Venerable Banner King explained the correct teaching to his son in a speech called 'My teaching of the king's teaching will benefit and comfort sentient beings, end worldly doubts, and eliminate numerous faults.'

source_sentence: 一切諸天主，　　及以人中王；　　當生歡喜心，　　合掌聽我說。
translation: All the lords of heaven and kings among men will rejoice, join their palms, and listen to my teaching.

source_sentence: 往昔諸天眾，　　集在金剛山；　　四王從座起，　　請問於大梵：　「梵主最勝尊，　　天中大自在；　　願哀愍我等，　　為斷諸疑惑。
translation: In the past, a multitude of gods gathered on Vajragiri; four kings rose from their seats and asked Brahmā, "Most honored is Brahmā, the great sovereign among gods; have compassion on us and help us end our doubts and confusions.

source_sentence: 云何處人世，　　而得名為天？
translation: Where in the human world was it that we were called gods?

source_sentence: 復以何因緣，　　號名曰天子？
translation: By what other cause is he called the Son of God?

source_sentence: 云何生人間，　　獨得為人主？
translation: "How do human beings alone become the lords of men?

source_sentence: 云何在天上，　　復得作天王？」
translation: How can I again become king of the gods up in heaven?"

source_sentence: 如是護世間，　　問彼梵王已。
translation: After thus defending the world, he asked that Brahma king about it.

source_sentence: 爾時梵天主，　　即便為彼說：　「護世汝當知，　　為利有情故；　　問我治國法，　　我說應善聽。
translation: The Brahma lord then even spoke for them, "You should know that you protect the world for the benefit of sentient beings, and ask me about the way to govern your country, and listen well when I tell you.

source_sentence: 由先善業力，　　生天得作王；　　若在於人中，　　統領為人主。
translation: Because of the power of good actions in the past, you were born in heaven and became king; if you were among humans, you'd rule as their lord.

source_sentence: 諸天共加護，　　然後入母胎；　　既至母胎中，　　諸天復守護。
translation: They're all protected by the gods, and then they enter their mother's womb; once they're in the mother's womb, they're again guarded by the gods.

source_sentence: 雖生在人世，　　尊勝故名天；　　由諸天護持，　　亦得名天子。
translation: Although he was born in the human world, he's honored and therefore called a god; because the gods guard him, he's also called a son of the gods.

source_sentence: 三十三天主，　　分力助人王；　　及一切諸天，　　亦資自在力。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods share their power with the king of men, and all the gods also have their sovereign power.

source_sentence: 除滅諸非法，　　惡業令不生；　　教有情修善，　　使得生天上。
translation: He removes what's unlawful and prevents bad actions from arising, and he teaches sentient beings to cultivate goodness so they'll be born in the heavens.

source_sentence: 人及蘇羅眾，　　并揵闥婆等；　　羅剎栴茶羅，　　悉皆資半力。
translation: All humans, the sūras, gandharvas, and others, as well as the Rāṣṭrapāla caitya, are endowed with half power.

source_sentence: 父母資半力，　　令捨惡修善；　　諸天共護持，　　示其諸善報。
translation: Their parents' half-power causes them to abandon evil and cultivate goodness, and the gods jointly defend them and show them the results of goodness.

source_sentence: 若造諸惡業，　　令於現世中；　　諸天不護持，　　示其諸惡報。
translation: If they create bad actions that bring about the present world, the gods won't protect them and show them the results of bad actions.

source_sentence: 國人造惡業，　　王捨不禁制；　　斯非順正理，　　治擯當如法。
translation: When a country creates bad actions, the king's household does not restrain them; this is not in accord with the right principle, and it should be governed according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若見惡不遮，　　非法便滋長；　　遂令王國內，　　姦詐日增多。
translation: If he sees evil and doesn't restrain it, unlawful behavior will grow, and as a result, deceit will increase day by day within the king's kingdom.

source_sentence: 王見國中人，　　造惡不遮止；　　三十三天眾，　　咸生忿怒心。
translation: When the king sees that people in his country do evil and don't restrain it, the Trāyastriṃśa gods are all enraged.

source_sentence: 因此損國政，　　諂偽行世間；　　被他怨敵侵，　　破壞其國土。
translation: As a result, he undermines the kingdom's government, practices deceit in the world, is attacked by enemies, and destroys his land.

source_sentence: 居家及資具，　　積財皆散失；　　種種諂誑生，　　更互相侵奪。
translation: Their homes and belongings are scattered, and their accumulated wealth is lost; various kinds of deceit arise, and they plunder each other.

source_sentence: 由正法得王，　　而不行其法；　　國人皆破散，　　如象踏蓮池。
translation: Having attained kingship based on the right teaching, they don't practice the teaching; their countrymen are all scattered like elephants treading on a lotus pond.

source_sentence: 惡風起無恒，　　暴雨非時下；　　妖星多變怪，　　日月蝕無光。
translation: A fierce wind arises without constancy, and torrential rains fall at odd times; demonic stars are often strange, and the sun and moon are dimmed.

source_sentence: 五穀眾花果，　　果實皆不成；　　國土遭飢饉，　　由王捨正法。
translation: The fruits of the five grains and flowers fail to materialize, and the land suffers from famine because the king has abandoned the right teaching.

source_sentence: 若王捨正法，　　以惡法化人；　　諸天處本宮，　　見已生憂惱。
translation: If the king disregards the right teaching and uses bad teachings to teach people, the gods in their home palaces become sad and distressed when they see them.

source_sentence: 彼諸天王眾，　　共作如是言：　『此王作非法，　　惡黨相親附。
translation: The host of heavenly kings all say this, 'This king has done something unlawful, and his evil gang is close to him.'

source_sentence: 王位不久安，　　諸天皆忿恨。』
translation: The king's position won't be secure for long, and the gods are all angry with him.'

source_sentence: 由彼懷忿故，　　其國當敗亡。
translation: Because of their anger, their kingdom will fall.

source_sentence: 以非法教人，　　流行於國內；　　鬪諍多姦偽，　　疾疫生眾苦。
translation: Because they teach people unlawfully, it spreads throughout the country, fighting, adultery, and falsehood, and illness and disease cause much suffering.

source_sentence: 天主不護念，　　餘天咸捨棄；　　國土當滅亡，　　王身受苦厄。
translation: When the gods don't protect their thoughts, the other gods abandon them; the land will perish, and the king's body will suffer hardships.

source_sentence: 父母及妻子，　　兄弟并姊妹；　　俱遭愛別離，　　乃至身亡歿。
translation: His father, mother, wife, brothers, and sisters are all separated from their loves, and they perish.

source_sentence: 變怪流星墮，　　二日俱時出；　　他方怨賊來，　　國人遭喪亂。
translation: A strange meteor falls, and two suns arise at once; resentful thieves from another land come, and the king's people are killed and disrupted.

source_sentence: 國所重大臣，　　枉橫而身死；　　所愛象馬等，　　亦復皆散失。
translation: The state's most valued ministers die in vain, and their beloved elephants and horses are also scattered.

source_sentence: 處處有兵戈，　　人多非法死；　　惡鬼來入國，　　疾疫遍流行。
translation: There are wars everywhere, many people die illegally, and bad spirits enter the country, and epidemics spread everywhere.

source_sentence: 國中最大臣，　　及以諸輔相；　　其心懷諂侫，　　並悉行非法。
translation: The country's most powerful ministers and their assistants are all guilty of flattery and unlawful behavior.

source_sentence: 見行非法者，　　而生於愛敬；　　於行善法人，　　苦楚而治罰。
translation: Seeing someone who does what's unlawful, they develop respect for them; whereas someone who does what's good is punished with pain.

source_sentence: 由愛敬惡人，　　治罰善人故；　　星宿及風雨，　　皆不以時行。
translation: Because they love and revere bad people and punish good people, the stars, constellations, and wind and rain don't act at the right time.

source_sentence: 有三種過生，　　正法當隱沒；　　眾生無光色，　　地肥皆下沈。
translation: There are three kinds of faults that arise, which will cause the right Dharma to disappear; sentient beings lack radiance and color, and the earth is fattened and sunken.

source_sentence: 由敬惡輕善，　　復有三種過；　　非時降霜雹，　　飢疫苦流行。
translation: Because they respect what's bad and despise what's good, there are three more faults; frost and hail fall at inopopportune times, and famine and epidemics are widespread.

source_sentence: 穀稼諸果實，　　滋味皆損減；　　於其國土中，　　眾生多疾病。
translation: The taste of the fruits of the harvest is diminished, and in their land, sentient beings are often sick.

source_sentence: 國中諸樹木，　　先生甘美果；　　由斯皆損減，　　苦澁無滋味。
translation: The trees in that land, which produce sweet fruit, are diminished, and their bitterness is tasteless.

source_sentence: 先有妙園林，　　可愛遊戲處；　　忽然皆枯悴，　　見者生憂惱。
translation: Once there was a wonderful garden, a lovely place to play, but suddenly it all withers, and those who see it become sad and distressed.

source_sentence: 稻麥諸果實，　　美味漸消亡；　　食時心不喜，　　何能長諸大。
translation: The delicious taste of the fruits of rice and wheat gradually disappears; when they're eaten, their hearts aren't pleased, so how can they grow in size?

source_sentence: 眾生光色減，　　勢力盡衰微；　　食噉雖復多，　　不能令飽足。
translation: The luster of sentient beings diminishes, and their strength completely declines; even though they eat and eat a lot, they can't get enough.

source_sentence: 於其國界中，　　所有眾生類；　　少力無勇勢，　　所作不堪能。
translation: Within their borders, there are all kinds of sentient beings with little strength and no courage, and what they do is beyond their ability.

source_sentence: 國人多疾患，　　眾苦逼其身；　　鬼魅遍流行，　　隨處生羅剎。
translation: Their people are often sick and afflicted, and their bodies are stifled by numerous sufferings; demons and ghosts are prevalent everywhere, and rājasasas are born everywhere.

source_sentence: 若王作非法，　　親近於惡人；　　令三種世間，　　因斯受衰損。
translation: If the king does something unlawful, he becomes intimate with evil people and causes the three worlds to suffer as a result.

source_sentence: 如是無邊過，　　出在於國中；　　皆由見惡人，　　棄捨不治擯。
translation: Such limitless faults occur in countries, and it's all because they see a bad person and abandon ungovernable rejection.

source_sentence: 由諸天加護，　　得作於國王；　　而不以正法，　　守護於國界。
translation: Because the gods protect him, he's made king of the country, but he doesn't guard the country's borders with the right teaching.

source_sentence: 若人修善行，　　當得生天上；　　若造惡業者，　　死必墮三塗。
translation: If someone cultivates good qualities, they'll be born in heaven; if they do bad actions, they'll surely fall into the three destinies when they die.

source_sentence: 若王見國人，　　縱其造過失；　　三十三天眾，　　皆生熱惱心。
translation: If the king sees a person in his country and allows them to commit a mistake, the Trāyastriṃśa gods will all become enthusiastic about it.

source_sentence: 不順諸天教，　　及以父母言；　　此是非法人，　　非王非孝子。
translation: Disobeying the teachings of the gods and the words of their parents, this is an unrighteous person who's not the king or a dutiful son.

source_sentence: 若於自國中，　　見行非法者；　　如法當治罰，　　不應生捨棄。
translation: If they see someone in their own country who's acting unlawfully, they'll be punished according to the Dharma and shouldn't be discarded.

source_sentence: 是故諸天眾，　　皆護持此王；　　以滅諸惡法，　　能修善根故。
translation: Therefore, all the gods will support the king because it will cease bad qualities and cultivate good roots.

source_sentence: 王於此世中，　　必招於現報；　　由於善惡業，　　行捨勸眾生。
translation: In this world, the king will surely bring about the present rewards of doing good and bad actions and encouraging sentient beings to abandon them.

source_sentence: 為示善惡報，　　故得作人王；　　諸天共護持，　　一切咸隨喜。
translation: To show the results of good and bad actions, he'll become a human king who's supported by gods and liked by everyone.

source_sentence: 由自利利他，　　治國以正法；　　見有諂侫者，　　應當如法治。
translation: Because he benefits himself and others, he rules his country with the right principles; if he sees someone who flatters and squawks, he'll rule accordingly.

source_sentence: 假使失王位，　　及以害命緣；　　終不行惡法，　　見惡而捨棄。
translation: Suppose he loses his position as king and takes on the condition of harming life; never does he practice bad qualities, and he discards evil when he sees it.

source_sentence: 害中極重者，　　無過失國位；　　皆因諂侫人，　　為此當治罰。
translation: The most serious harm is nothing greater than losing one's position in the kingdom; it's all because of flatterers and squabblers, and for that reason they should be punished.

source_sentence: 若有諂誑人，　　當失於國位；　　由斯損王政，　　如象入花園。
translation: If someone flatters and cheats, they'll lose their position in the kingdom; thus, they'll undermine the king's administration like an elephant in a garden.

source_sentence: 天主皆瞋恨，　　阿蘇羅亦然；　　以彼為人王，　　不以法治國。
translation: All gods are angry, and so is Asura; because he's a human king, he doesn't rule the country with that.

source_sentence: 是故應如法，　　治罰於惡人；　　以善化眾生，　　不順於非法。
translation: Therefore, you should punish evildoers according to the Dharma and transform sentient beings with goodness, not with disobedience to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 寧捨於身命，　　不隨非法友；　　於親及非親，　　平等觀一切。
translation: They would rather abandon their lives than follow unlawful friends, and they would equally observe all people, whether they're related or not.

source_sentence: 若為正法王，　　國內無偏黨；　　法王有名稱，　　普聞三界中。
translation: If he were the rightful king of the Dharma, there'd be no partiality within his country, and the king of the Dharma would be known by name and heard universally throughout the three realms.

source_sentence: 三十三天眾，　　歡喜作是言：　『贍部洲法王，　　彼即是我子。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods rejoice as they say, 'The Dharma king of Jambudvīpa, he's my son.

source_sentence: 以善化眾生，　　正法治於國；　　勸行於正法，　　當令生我宮。』
translation: He trains sentient beings well, correctly rules the country, and encourages the practice of the right Dharma, so they'll be born in my palace.'

source_sentence: 天及諸天子，　　及以蘇羅眾；　　因王正法化，　　常得心歡喜。
translation: The gods, godchildren, and the multitude of sūras are always encouraged by the king's right teaching.

source_sentence: 天眾皆歡喜，　　共護於人王；　　眾星依位行，　　日月無乖度。
translation: The gods are all rejoicing, and they all protect the human king; the stars travel in accordance with their positions, and the sun and moon don't deviate from each other.

source_sentence: 和風常應節，　　甘雨順時行；　　苗實皆善成，　　人無飢饉者。
translation: The gentle winds always respond to the seasons, and sweet rain follows the seasons; the seedlings are all well-produced, and no one goes hungry.

source_sentence: 一切諸天眾，　　充滿於自宮；　　是故汝人王，　　亡身弘正法。
translation: All the gods fill their own palaces; therefore, you, King of Men, have given up your life to spread the right teaching.

source_sentence: 應尊重法寶，　　由斯眾安樂；　　常當親正法，　　功德自莊嚴。
translation: Respect the treasures of the Dharma, for the well-being of all people, and always adorn yourself with the virtues of the right Dharma.

source_sentence: 眷屬常歡喜，　　能遠離諸惡；　　以法化眾生，　　恒令得安隱。
translation: Your followers will always rejoice, keeping them free from evil and teaching sentient beings by the Dharma, always making them comfortable.

source_sentence: 令彼一切人，　　修行於十善；　　率土常豐樂，　　國土得安寧。
translation: He causes all of them to cultivate the ten good qualities, leading their land to be always abundant and comfortable, and their land to attain peace.

translation: By teaching people the Dharma, the king skillfully regulates bad behavior, always attains a good reputation, and pleases all sentient beings."'"

source_sentence: 爾時，大地一切人王及諸大眾，聞佛說此古昔人王治國要法，得未曾有，皆大歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: At the time, all the human kings and great multitudes of the great land who heard the Buddha teach this essential way of governing the country of human kings from an ancient past that had never existed before were greatly elated, believed, and approved.
